plead.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to ask for something that you want very much, in a sincere and emotional way
plead.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Civil rights groups pleaded for government help.
Moira pleaded with him to stay.
plead.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to state in a court of law whether or not you are guilty of a crime
plead.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to give reasons why you think something is true or why something should be done
plead.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Residents successfully pleaded their case at a council meeting.
Managers pleaded that there was not enough time to make the changes.
plead.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to state in a court of law whether you are guilty of a crime or not
plead.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Charged with fraud for selling the fakes, they agreed to plead guilty (=to admit that they did the crime).
He pleaded no contest to (=said that he would not defend himself against) two assault charges and resigned his office in disgrace.
